metadata.philosophy: Metabolic-first nutrition - glucose-stable, whole-food focused, protein-anchored meals that are practical and family-friendly

recipes.title: Classic Buttermilk Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: The OG stack that started it all. Fluffy, satisfying, and packed with 30g of protein. Your new Sunday morning ritual.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water until just combined. A few lumps are fine - don't overmix!
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of butter.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the pan.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and edges look set, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Stack and serve with fresh berries and a dollop of Greek yogurt.
tips: Let the batter rest for 2 minutes for fluffier pancakes
Medium heat is key - too hot and they'll burn before cooking through

recipes.title: Chocolate Banana Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Dessert for breakfast? Yes please. Naturally sweetened with banana and rich chocolate flavour. Kids (and adults) go crazy for these.
instructions: Mash the banana in a bowl until smooth.
Add pancake mix and water, stir until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips if using.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat with butter.
Pour batter to form pancakes, cook 2-3 minutes per side.
Top with sliced banana and an extra sprinkle of chocolate chips.
tips: The riper the banana, the sweeter and fluffier your pancakes
Add a pinch of cinnamon for extra warmth

recipes.title: Cinnamon Roll Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: All the cozy cinnamon roll vibes without the sugar crash. Swirled with cinnamon and topped with a light cream cheese drizzle.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water until combined.
In a small bowl, mix cream cheese, yogurt, and vanilla for the drizzle.
Heat pan over medium heat.
Pour batter, then use a toothpick to swirl extra cinnamon through the top.
Cook 2 minutes per side until golden.
Stack and drizzle with the cream cheese mixture.
tips: Warm the cream cheese drizzle slightly for easier pouring
These reheat beautifully - make extra for the week

recipes.title: Blueberry Lemon Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Bright, fresh, and bursting with antioxidants. The lemon zest cuts through beautifully and makes these taste like summer.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water and lemon zest.
Gently fold in half the blueberries.
Cook pancakes over medium heat, 2 minutes per side.
Serve topped with remaining blueberries, yogurt, and a squeeze of lemon.
tips: Frozen blueberries work great - no need to thaw
Don't press down on pancakes while cooking

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Nutty, satisfying, and absolutely loaded with protein. Add sliced banana on top for the ultimate PB&B combo.
instructions: Warm peanut butter slightly to make it easier to mix.
Combine pancake mix, 1 tbsp peanut butter, and water.
Cook pancakes over medium heat until golden on both sides.
Top with remaining peanut butter, sliced banana, and honey drizzle.
tips: Use natural peanut butter without added sugar or oils
Almond butter works great as a substitute

recipes.title: Apple Pie Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Warm spiced apples folded into fluffy pancakes. Like apple pie but make it healthy and high-protein.
instructions: Sauté diced apple with butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg until softened, about 3 minutes.
Mix pancake mix with water.
Fold half the cooked apples into the batter.
Cook pancakes over medium heat.
Top with remaining warm apples and Greek yogurt.
tips: Granny Smith apples hold their shape best when cooked
Make extra spiced apples - they're great on oatmeal too

recipes.title: Savoury Spinach & Feta Pancakes
recipes.description: Who said pancakes have to be sweet? These savoury stacks are perfect for those who prefer eggs over sugar in the morning.
instructions: Wilt spinach in a pan with olive oil, set aside to cool slightly.
Mix pancake mix with water, fold in cooled spinach and half the feta.
Cook pancakes over medium heat until golden.
Top with remaining feta, cherry tomatoes, and black pepper.
tips: Add a poached egg on top for extra protein
Sun-dried tomatoes work great instead of fresh

recipes.title: Matcha Green Tea Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Earthy, subtly sweet, and gorgeous green. Packed with antioxidants and a gentle caffeine boost to start your day.
instructions: Whisk matcha powder into the pancake mix to avoid clumps.
Add water and mix until just combined.
Cook over medium-low heat - matcha can burn easily.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with toasted coconut.
tips: Use culinary grade matcha - ceremonial grade is wasted in cooking
Lower heat than normal to prevent the matcha from becoming bitter

recipes.title: Bacon & Maple Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: The sweet-salty combo that dreams are made of. Crispy bacon bits folded right into fluffy maple-kissed pancakes.
instructions: Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble or chop into small pieces.
Mix pancake mix with water, fold in half the bacon bits.
Cook pancakes in a little bacon fat or butter.
Top with remaining bacon and a drizzle of maple syrup.
tips: Use the bacon fat to cook the pancakes for extra flavour
Real maple syrup only - skip the fake stuff

recipes.title: Tropical Coconut Mango Pancakes
recipes.description: Transport yourself to the beach with these tropical beauties. Fresh mango, toasted coconut, and a hint of lime.
instructions: Toast shredded coconut in a dry pan until golden, set aside.
Mix pancake mix with coconut milk and lime zest.
Cook pancakes over medium heat.
Top with fresh mango, toasted coconut, and a squeeze of lime.
tips: Frozen mango works great when fresh isn't in season
Full-fat coconut milk makes these extra rich

recipes.title: Chocolate Hazelnut Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Nutella vibes but make it healthy. Rich chocolate pancakes topped with crushed hazelnuts and a light chocolate drizzle.
instructions: Toast hazelnuts in a dry pan until fragrant.
Mix pancake mix with water.
Cook pancakes over medium heat.
Top with Greek yogurt, crushed hazelnuts, and melted dark chocolate drizzle.
tips: Rub toasted hazelnuts in a tea towel to remove skins
70% dark chocolate keeps the sugar down

recipes.title: Strawberries & Cream Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Fresh strawberries and pillowy whipped cream on fluffy pancakes. Simple, elegant, and absolutely delicious.
instructions: Whip cream with vanilla until soft peaks form.
Mix pancake mix with water.
Cook pancakes over medium heat until golden.
Layer with sliced strawberries and dollops of whipped cream.
tips: Macerate strawberries with a tiny bit of honey for extra juiciness
Cottage cheese blended smooth is a high-protein cream substitute

recipes.title: Carrot Cake Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: All the warm spices of carrot cake in pancake form. Grated carrot keeps them incredibly moist and adds hidden veggies.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water and nutmeg.
Fold in grated carrot.
Cook pancakes over medium heat - they'll take a bit longer due to the carrot.
Mix cream cheese with yogurt for the frosting.
Top pancakes with cream cheese mixture and chopped walnuts.
tips: Fine grate the carrot so it cooks through properly
Great for hiding veggies from kids

recipes.title: Churro Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Crispy edges, soft center, coated in cinnamon sugar (but make it healthy). Dunk in chocolate sauce if you're feeling fancy.
instructions: Mix coconut sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl.
Prepare batter with pancake mix and water.
Cook pancakes until golden with slightly crispy edges.
While warm, dust with cinnamon sugar mixture.
Serve with melted dark chocolate for dipping.
tips: Press pancakes slightly flatter for crispier edges
Coconut sugar has a lower glycemic impact than regular sugar

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Pancakes
recipes.description: Brunch goals achieved. Savoury pancakes topped with silky smoked salmon, cream cheese, and fresh dill.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water, cook pancakes until golden.
Spread cream cheese over warm pancakes.
Top with smoked salmon, capers, and fresh dill.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon.
tips: Let the cream cheese come to room temperature for easier spreading
Hot smoked salmon works great too for a different texture

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt Protein Bowl
recipes.description: Thick, creamy Greek yogurt loaded with nuts, seeds, and berries. 35g protein before you even try.
instructions: Add Greek yogurt to a bowl.
Top with berries, almonds, and chia seeds.
Drizzle with honey if desired.
tips: Make it overnight by mixing chia seeds into yogurt the night before
Full-fat Greek yogurt keeps you fuller longer

recipes.title: Veggie-Loaded Egg Muffins
recipes.description: Meal prep MVP. Make a batch on Sunday and have grab-and-go protein all week. Fully customisable with your favourite veggies.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin.
Divide vegetables evenly among muffin cups.
Whisk eggs with salt and pepper, pour over vegetables.
Top with crumbled feta.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until set.
Store in fridge for up to 5 days.
tips: Line with paper cases for easier removal
Reheat in microwave for 30 seconds

recipes.title: Overnight Protein Oats
recipes.description: Set it and forget it. Wake up to creamy, protein-packed oats that taste like dessert but fuel like a champion.
instructions: Combine oats, yogurt, milk, protein powder, chia seeds, and honey in a jar.
Stir well to combine, ensuring no protein powder clumps.
Seal and refrigerate overnight (or at least 4 hours).
Top with berries before eating.
tips: Add protein powder gradually to avoid clumps
Can be stored for up to 3 days in the fridge

recipes.title: Smashed Avo & Poached Eggs
recipes.description: The café classic done right at home. Perfectly poached eggs over creamy avocado on seedy toast.
instructions: Toast the sourdough until golden.
Smash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and chilli flakes.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer, create a whirlpool, and slide in eggs.
Poach for 3 minutes for runny yolks.
Spread smashed avo on toast, top with poached eggs and tomatoes.
tips: Add a splash of vinegar to the poaching water for neater eggs
Fresh eggs poach better than older ones

recipes.title: Protein Green Smoothie
recipes.description: Don't knock it till you try it. This tastes like a creamy vanilla shake but sneaks in a huge serving of greens.
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend on high until completely smooth.
Add more almond milk if too thick.
tips: Frozen spinach works too and makes it even thicker
Add a handful of frozen cauliflower for extra creaminess without changing taste

recipes.title: Turkish Eggs (Çılbır)
recipes.description: Poached eggs over garlicky yogurt with spiced butter. Sounds weird, tastes incredible. Trust us on this one.
instructions: Mix yogurt with garlic and a pinch of salt, spread on a plate.
Poach eggs for 3 minutes.
Melt butter, add paprika and chilli, let sizzle for 30 seconds.
Place eggs on yogurt, drizzle with spiced butter.
Garnish with dill and serve with bread.
tips: Room temperature yogurt works best
The spiced butter should sizzle - that's where the flavour comes from

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: The protein powerhouse that's having a moment. Creamy cottage cheese with fruit and a drizzle of honey.
instructions: Add cottage cheese to a bowl.
Top with sliced peach and pecans.
Drizzle with honey and dust with cinnamon.
tips: Blend cottage cheese smooth if you don't like the texture
Any stone fruit works beautifully here

recipes.title: Shakshuka
recipes.description: Eggs poached in spiced tomato sauce. One pan, minimal effort, maximum flavour. Perfect for lazy weekend mornings.
instructions: Sauté onion and capsicum in olive oil until soft.
Add garlic, cumin, and paprika, cook 1 minute.
Pour in tomatoes, simmer 10 minutes until thickened.
Make 4 wells and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook 5-7 minutes until eggs are set.
Top with feta and parsley, serve with bread.
tips: The sauce can be made ahead and reheated before adding eggs
Add a pinch of sugar if the tomatoes are too acidic

recipes.title: High-Protein Banana Bread Muffins
recipes.description: All the banana bread vibes in portable muffin form. Perfect for meal prep or a quick breakfast on the run.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Line muffin tin.
Mash bananas, mix in eggs and yogurt.
Add dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in walnuts if using.
Divide among 8 muffin cups.
Bake 18-20 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
tips: The riper the bananas, the sweeter the muffins
Freeze for up to 3 months

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon
recipes.description: Silky, buttery scrambled eggs with flakes of smoked salmon and fresh chives. Breakfast luxury in 10 minutes.
instructions: Whisk eggs with a pinch of salt.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over low heat.
Add eggs, stir continuously with a spatula.
When almost set, remove from heat and fold in cream cheese.
Top with smoked salmon, chives, and pepper.
tips: Low and slow is the key to silky scrambled eggs
Remove from heat while still slightly wet - they'll continue cooking

recipes.title: Lemon Herb Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Bright, fresh, and satisfying. Juicy lemon-marinated chicken over crunchy greens with a zesty dressing.
instructions: Marinate chicken in half the lemon juice, garlic, and herbs for 10 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side.
Let rest 5 minutes, then slice.
Toss greens with cucumber, tomatoes, and onion.
Whisk remaining lemon juice with olive oil for dressing.
Top salad with sliced chicken and drizzle with dressing.
tips: Pound chicken to even thickness for faster, even cooking
This is great meal prepped - keep chicken and salad separate until eating

recipes.title: Mediterranean Tuna Lettuce Wraps
recipes.description: Light but filling. Quality tuna mixed with olives, feta, and sun-dried tomatoes wrapped in crisp butter lettuce.
instructions: Mix tuna with feta, olives, sun-dried tomatoes, and red onion.
Add lemon juice and dill, toss gently.
Divide mixture among lettuce cups.
Serve immediately.
tips: Use quality tuna packed in olive oil for best flavor
Add a drizzle of balsamic glaze for extra depth

recipes.title: Asian Beef & Broccoli Bowl
recipes.description: Better than takeaway and ready in 20 minutes. Tender beef strips with crisp broccoli in a savory sauce over cauliflower rice.
instructions: Heat half the sesame oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Stir-fry beef for 2-3 minutes until browned, set aside.
Add remaining oil, stir-fry broccoli for 3-4 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
Return beef, add soy sauce, toss to combine.
Serve over cauliflower rice, garnish with sesame seeds.
tips: Freeze beef for 15 minutes for easier slicing
High heat is essential for that restaurant-style sear

recipes.title: Greek Chicken Grain Bowl
recipes.description: Grilled chicken, quinoa, hummus, and all the Mediterranean fixings. Filling, nutritious, and meal prep friendly.
instructions: Season chicken with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry until cooked through, slice.
Arrange quinoa in a bowl.
Add cucumber, tomatoes, onion, olives, and feta.
Top with sliced chicken and hummus.
Drizzle with olive oil.
tips: Batch cook quinoa on Sunday for easy weekday lunches
Add tzatziki instead of hummus for a creamy twist

recipes.title: Thai Prawn Rice Paper Rolls
recipes.description: Fresh, light, and packed with crunchy vegetables. These rice paper rolls are like a salad you can hold.
instructions: Prep all vegetables and herbs.
Dip rice paper in warm water until pliable.
Layer lettuce, vermicelli, vegetables, herbs, and prawns.
Fold sides in, then roll tightly from bottom.
Serve with peanut dipping sauce.
tips: Don't over-soak the rice paper - 10-15 seconds is enough
Roll tightly for clean, neat rolls

recipes.title: Chicken Caesar Salad (No Croutons)
recipes.description: The classic reimagined without the carb-heavy croutons. Crispy bacon bits add the crunch instead.
instructions: Cook bacon until crispy, set aside and crumble.
In the same pan, cook chicken breast until golden and cooked through.
Let rest, then slice.
Toss lettuce with dressing.
Top with chicken, bacon, parmesan, and anchovies if using.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon.
tips: Make your own Caesar dressing with Greek yogurt for extra protein
Crispy prosciutto works as a bacon substitute

recipes.title: Spicy Tuna Poke Bowl
recipes.description: Fresh sushi-grade tuna over rice with all the toppings. Restaurant quality at home.
instructions: Mix tuna with soy sauce, sriracha, and sesame oil. Let marinate 5 minutes.
Place rice in a bowl.
Arrange tuna, edamame, cucumber, and avocado on top.
Garnish with nori and sesame seeds.
tips: Only use sushi-grade fish for poke
Cauliflower rice works for a low-carb version

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Burrito Bowl
recipes.description: All the Chipotle vibes without leaving home. Spiced chicken, black beans, corn, and all the toppings.
instructions: Season chicken with cumin and paprika.
Grill or pan-fry until cooked through, slice.
Arrange rice, beans, corn, tomatoes, and avocado in a bowl.
Top with sliced chicken.
Garnish with coriander, yogurt, and lime.
tips: Make quick pickled onions for an authentic touch
Meal prep the components separately for easy assembly

recipes.title: Salmon Niçoise Salad
recipes.description: The French classic upgraded with fresh salmon. A composed salad that's almost too pretty to eat.
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, drain. Blanch green beans, shock in ice water.
Soft boil eggs (6 minutes), peel and halve.
Pan-fry salmon skin-side down 4 minutes, flip, cook 2 more minutes.
Whisk oil, mustard, and vinegar for dressing.
Arrange all components on a plate, drizzle with dressing.
tips: Everything can be served warm or at room temperature
This is a great use for leftover roasted potatoes

recipes.title: Turkey & Avocado Lettuce Wraps
recipes.description: Clean, lean, and incredibly satisfying. Ground turkey with fresh avocado in crisp lettuce cups.
instructions: Cook turkey with garlic and ginger until browned.
Add soy sauce and cook 2 more minutes.
Spoon turkey into lettuce cups.
Top with avocado, spring onion, lime juice, and chilli.
tips: Chicken mince works equally well
Add water chestnuts for extra crunch

recipes.title: Caprese Chicken Stack
recipes.description: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil over perfectly grilled chicken. Italian simplicity at its finest.
instructions: Butterfly the chicken breast for even cooking.
Season and grill or pan-fry until cooked through.
Layer mozzarella slices on hot chicken to slightly melt.
Top with tomato slices and basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
tips: Use room temperature mozzarella for better melting
Fresh summer tomatoes make all the difference

recipes.title: Korean Beef Bibimbap Bowl
recipes.description: A colourful Korean classic with seasoned beef, crisp vegetables, and a runny egg on top. Mix it all together for magic.
instructions: Season beef with 1 tbsp soy sauce and garlic, cook until browned.
Sauté each vegetable separately with a little sesame oil.
Blanch spinach and season with soy sauce.
Fry egg sunny-side up.
Arrange rice in bowl, top with beef, vegetables, and egg.
Serve with gochujang on the side.
tips: Mix everything together before eating for authentic experience
A hot stone bowl creates the crispy rice bottom

recipes.title: Zucchini Noodle Pad Thai
recipes.description: All the Pad Thai flavour with zucchini noodles instead of rice noodles. Lower carb, same amazing taste.
instructions: Mix fish sauce, lime juice, tamarind, and coconut sugar for sauce.
Stir-fry prawns until pink, set aside.
Scramble egg in the same pan, set aside.
Add zucchini noodles, cook 2 minutes.
Add sauce, prawns, and egg, toss together.
Top with bean sprouts, spring onion, and peanuts.
tips: Don't overcook the zucchini - it releases water quickly
Pat zucchini noodles dry before cooking

recipes.title: Egg Salad Stuffed Avocados
recipes.description: Creamy egg salad meets perfectly ripe avocado. Simple, satisfying, and packed with healthy fats.
instructions: Chop hard-boiled eggs.
Mix with Greek yogurt, mustard, chives, and lemon juice.
Scoop out a bit more avocado to create deeper wells.
Mash scooped avocado into the egg mixture.
Fill avocado halves with egg salad, dust with paprika.
tips: Add bacon bits for extra protein and flavour
Everything bagel seasoning is amazing on top

recipes.title: Vietnamese Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Crunchy cabbage, fresh herbs, and shredded chicken with a tangy lime dressing. Light but incredibly flavourful.
instructions: Toss cabbages and carrot together.
Whisk lime juice, fish sauce, and coconut sugar.
Add chicken and herbs to the salad.
Drizzle with dressing and toss well.
Top with crushed peanuts.
tips: Rotisserie chicken works perfectly here
Make the salad ahead but add dressing just before serving

recipes.title: Herb-Crusted Salmon with Asparagus
recipes.description: Restaurant-quality salmon at home. Crispy herb crust with tender, flaky fish and perfectly roasted asparagus.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Toss asparagus with olive oil and garlic, spread on baking tray.
Mix herbs with panko and lemon zest.
Brush salmon with mustard, press herb mixture on top.
Place salmon on tray with asparagus.
Roast 15-18 minutes until salmon is cooked through.
tips: Check salmon at 12 minutes - you want it just slightly pink in center
Thick asparagus works better for roasting

recipes.title: Lemon Garlic Chicken Thighs
recipes.description: Crispy-skinned, juicy chicken thighs with punchy lemon and garlic. The kind of dinner that makes you feel like a chef.
instructions: Season chicken generously with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in oven-safe pan, add chicken skin-side down.
Cook without moving for 8 minutes until skin is crispy.
Flip chicken, add garlic, thyme, and lemon juice.
Transfer to 200°C (400°F) oven for 20-25 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes, spoon pan juices over chicken.
tips: Pat chicken completely dry for crispier skin
A cast iron pan gives the best browning

recipes.title: Beef Stir-Fry with Vegetables
recipes.description: Quick, colourful, and packed with flavour. Tender beef strips with crunchy vegetables in a savoury sauce.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil for sauce.
Heat wok or large pan over high heat with oil.
Stir-fry beef in batches until browned, set aside.
Stir-fry vegetables for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
Return beef, add sauce, toss until heated through.
tips: Work in batches to avoid steaming the beef
Have everything prepped before you start - it goes fast

recipes.title: Baked Mediterranean Chicken
recipes.description: Sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and artichokes roasted with chicken. Like a Mediterranean holiday on a plate.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place chicken in baking dish, season with oregano, salt, pepper.
Scatter artichokes, tomatoes, and olives around chicken.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Bake 30-35 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Top with crumbled feta before serving.
tips: Use chicken thighs for even more flavour and moisture
Serve over cauliflower rice or with a big salad

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Prawns
recipes.description: Restaurant-style garlic prawns ready in 10 minutes. Succulent prawns swimming in garlic butter sauce.
instructions: Pat prawns dry, season with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add prawns in single layer, cook 2 minutes per side.
Add garlic and chilli, cook 30 seconds.
Add wine and lemon juice, let bubble 1 minute.
Finish with parsley and serve immediately.
tips: Don't overcrowd the pan or prawns will steam
Serve with crusty bread to soak up the sauce

recipes.title: Turkey Meatballs in Marinara
recipes.description: Lean turkey meatballs simmered in rich tomato sauce. Comfort food that's actually good for you.
instructions: Mix turkey, egg, almond flour, parmesan, and seasoning.
Roll into golf ball-sized meatballs.
Brown meatballs in olive oil, about 3 minutes per side.
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds.
Pour in tomatoes, simmer 15-20 minutes.
Garnish with fresh basil.
tips: Wet your hands to prevent sticking when rolling meatballs
Great over zucchini noodles or spaghetti squash

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas
recipes.description: All the sizzling fajita flavour with minimal cleanup. Chicken and peppers roast together on one pan.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Toss chicken and vegetables with spices and oil.
Spread on a large baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway.
Squeeze lime juice over and garnish with coriander.
Serve in lettuce wraps or low-carb tortillas.
tips: Don't overcrowd the pan - use two if needed
Broil for 2 minutes at the end for charred edges

recipes.title: Grilled Lamb Cutlets with Mint Yogurt
recipes.description: Juicy lamb cutlets with a cool mint yogurt sauce. Simple, elegant, and absolutely delicious.
instructions: Mix olive oil, garlic, and rosemary. Rub over lamb cutlets.
Let marinate 10 minutes or up to overnight.
Mix yogurt, mint, lemon juice, and cucumber for sauce.
Grill or pan-fry lamb 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest 5 minutes before serving with mint yogurt.
tips: Bring lamb to room temperature before cooking
Don't move the cutlets while cooking for best sear

recipes.title: Thai Coconut Curry Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy, aromatic, and packed with vegetables. This Thai-inspired curry is comfort in a bowl.
instructions: Heat a splash of coconut cream from the can until sizzling.
Fry curry paste for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chicken, cook until browned.
Pour in coconut milk, add vegetables.
Simmer 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Stir in fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice.
Top with Thai basil before serving.
tips: Use the thick cream from the top of the coconut can for frying
Regular basil works if you can't find Thai basil

recipes.title: Stuffed Capsicums
recipes.description: Colourful capsicums stuffed with seasoned beef and cauliflower rice. A classic made low-carb.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Cut tops off capsicums, remove seeds.
Sauté onion in oil, add beef and cook until browned.
Stir in cauliflower rice, tomatoes, and seasoning.
Fill capsicums with beef mixture.
Top with mozzarella, bake 30-35 minutes.
Serve hot.
tips: Par-boil capsicums for 3 minutes if you like them softer
Great for meal prep - reheat well

recipes.title: Pan-Seared Barramundi with Lemon Caper Butter
recipes.description: Crispy-skinned barramundi with a tangy caper butter sauce. Australian fish at its finest.
instructions: Pat fish dry, season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Add fish skin-side down, press gently for 30 seconds.
Cook 4-5 minutes until skin is crispy, flip for 2 minutes.
Remove fish, add butter, garlic, capers, and lemon juice.
Let butter foam, stir in parsley.
Spoon sauce over fish.
tips: Very dry skin is essential for crispy results
Don't move the fish while the skin is crisping

recipes.title: Greek Style Lamb Kofta
recipes.description: Spiced lamb skewers with tzatziki and fresh salad. Street food vibes, home-cooked quality.
instructions: Mix lamb with onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, and parsley.
Form into sausage shapes around skewers.
Grill or pan-fry 10-12 minutes, turning regularly.
Make tzatziki by mixing yogurt, cucumber, mint, and garlic.
Serve kofta with tzatziki and fresh salad.
tips: Squeeze excess water from grated onion and cucumber
Let meat mixture rest 10 minutes for easier shaping

recipes.title: Chicken Cacciatore
recipes.description: Italian hunter-style chicken braised with tomatoes, peppers, and olives. Rustic comfort at its best.
instructions: Brown chicken in olive oil, about 4 minutes per side. Remove.
Sauté onion and capsicum until softened.
Add garlic, cook 1 minute.
Pour in wine, let reduce by half.
Add tomatoes, olives, and capers.
Return chicken to pan, cover and simmer 30-35 minutes.
Garnish with fresh basil.
tips: The sauce gets better the next day
Serve over polenta or cauliflower mash

recipes.title: Teriyaki Salmon Bowls
recipes.description: Glazed salmon over rice with pickled vegetables and avocado. Japanese-inspired goodness.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, honey, and ginger for teriyaki sauce.
Pan-fry salmon skin-side down 4 minutes, flip 2 minutes.
Add teriyaki sauce, let glaze for 1 minute.
Arrange rice in bowls with edamame and avocado.
Top with salmon and drizzle with remaining sauce.
Garnish with sesame seeds and pickled ginger.
tips: Make extra teriyaki sauce - it keeps for weeks
Cauliflower rice works for a low-carb version

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
recipes.description: Set it and forget it. Tender beef with root vegetables in a rich, savoury broth.
instructions: Brown beef in batches in oil, transfer to slow cooker.
Add all vegetables, stock, tomato paste, and herbs.
Cook on low 8 hours or high 4 hours.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove bay leaves and thyme stems before serving.
tips: Don't skip browning the meat - it adds huge flavour
Swap potatoes for turnips for lower carb

recipes.title: Protein Energy Balls
recipes.description: No-bake protein balls that taste like cookie dough. Perfect grab-and-go snack.
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl.
Add peanut butter and honey, stir until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Refrigerate 15 minutes until firm enough to roll.
Roll into 12 balls.
Store in fridge for up to 2 weeks.
tips: Add a splash of milk if mixture is too dry
Freeze for longer storage

recipes.title: Cucumber Tuna Bites
recipes.description: Crisp cucumber rounds topped with seasoned tuna. Light, refreshing, protein-packed.
instructions: Mix tuna with yogurt, lemon juice, and dill.
Slice cucumber into 1cm rounds.
Top each round with tuna mixture.
Sprinkle with everything bagel seasoning if using.
tips: Pat cucumber rounds dry for better topping adherence
Works great as a party appetiser

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs with a creamy, tangy filling. Timeless snack that's always a hit.
instructions: Boil eggs for 10-12 minutes, cool in ice bath.
Peel and halve eggs lengthwise.
Remove yolks, mash with yogurt, mustard, and vinegar.
Pipe or spoon filling back into whites.
Garnish with paprika and chives.
tips: Older eggs are easier to peel
Add bacon bits or smoked salmon for extra protein

recipes.title: Turkey & Cheese Roll-Ups
recipes.description: Simple, satisfying, and protein-packed. Turkey and cheese wrapped with mustard and veggies.
instructions: Lay turkey slices flat, spread with mustard.
Layer with cheese, spinach, and pickle slices.
Roll up tightly.
Secure with toothpicks if needed.
tips: Use cream cheese instead of mustard for variety
Great for lunch boxes

recipes.title: Spiced Roasted Chickpeas
recipes.description: Crunchy, addictive, and way better than chips. Roasted chickpeas with your favourite spices.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Pat chickpeas very dry with paper towels.
Toss with olive oil and spread on baking sheet.
Roast 30-40 minutes, shaking pan every 10 minutes.
Toss hot chickpeas with spices.
Cool completely for maximum crunch.
tips: Completely dry chickpeas are essential for crunch
Store in an open container - sealed makes them soft

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Dip with Veggies
recipes.description: Creamy cottage cheese blended smooth makes the best high-protein dip. Perfect with crunchy veggies.
instructions: Blend cottage cheese until completely smooth.
Mix in garlic powder, herbs, and lemon juice.
Serve with fresh vegetable sticks.
tips: Add a splash of milk for thinner consistency
Try ranch seasoning for a different flavour

recipes.title: Beef Jerky Trail Mix
recipes.description: Savoury trail mix with beef jerky, nuts, and seeds. The ultimate protein-packed snack mix.
instructions: Chop beef jerky into bite-sized pieces.
Combine with nuts and seeds.
Add chocolate chips for a sweet touch.
Store in an airtight container.
tips: Look for jerky without added sugar
Portion into small bags for grab-and-go

recipes.title: Edamame with Sea Salt
recipes.description: Simple steamed edamame with flaky sea salt. Japanese bar snack that's actually good for you.
instructions: Boil or steam edamame for 4-5 minutes.
Drain well.
Toss with sea salt and chilli flakes if using.
Serve warm.
tips: Try garlic butter for a richer version
Sesame oil and soy sauce is another great combo

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt Bark
recipes.description: Frozen yogurt bark studded with berries and nuts. Like ice cream but way more protein.
instructions: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix yogurt with honey and vanilla.
Spread evenly on prepared sheet, about 1cm thick.
Top with berries, almonds, and chocolate chips.
Freeze for at least 2 hours until solid.
Break into pieces and store in freezer.
tips: Work quickly once you remove from freezer - it melts fast
Try different toppings each time

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon Cucumber Boats
recipes.description: Elegant little bites of smoked salmon and cream cheese in cucumber boats. Perfect for guests or yourself.
instructions: Halve cucumbers lengthwise, scoop out seeds.
Mix cream cheese with dill and lemon zest.
Spread cream cheese mixture in cucumber boats.
Top with smoked salmon strips and capers.
Cut into bite-sized pieces.
tips: Use a melon baller to scoop out cucumber seeds
Make ahead and assemble just before serving

recipes.title: Chocolate Protein Mousse
recipes.description: Rich, silky chocolate mousse with a protein punch. Dessert that's actually good for you.
instructions: Blend all ingredients until completely smooth.
Scrape down sides and blend again.
Divide between serving glasses.
Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.
tips: Use room temperature tofu for smoother blending
Top with whipped cream and berries

recipes.title: Baked Cinnamon Apple Chips
recipes.description: Crispy apple chips dusted with cinnamon. Naturally sweet and satisfying.
instructions: Preheat oven to 100°C (200°F).
Slice apples paper-thin using a mandoline.
Arrange in single layer on baking sheets.
Dust with cinnamon and nutmeg.
Bake 2 hours, flipping halfway, until crispy.
Cool completely before storing.
tips: Thinner slices = crispier chips
Store in an open container to maintain crunch

recipes.title: Protein Cheesecake Cups
recipes.description: Creamy cheesecake in portion-controlled cups. All the indulgence with extra protein.
instructions: Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Add yogurt, protein powder, honey, and lemon juice.
Mix until completely combined.
Divide into 4 small cups or jars.
Refrigerate at least 2 hours.
Top with fresh berries before serving.
tips: Make a quick crust with crushed nuts and coconut oil
Keeps well in fridge for 5 days

recipes.title: Frozen Banana Bites
recipes.description: Banana slices dipped in dark chocolate and peanut butter. Simple, delicious, satisfying.
instructions: Line a tray with baking paper.
Slice bananas into 2cm rounds.
Spread a small amount of peanut butter on half the slices.
Sandwich with remaining slices.
Dip in melted chocolate, sprinkle with peanuts.
Freeze until solid, about 30 minutes.
tips: Work quickly with the chocolate before it sets
Store in freezer for up to 2 weeks

recipes.title: Berry Chia Pudding
recipes.description: Creamy chia pudding layered with fresh berries. Make it before bed, enjoy for breakfast or dessert.
instructions: Mix chia seeds, coconut milk, vanilla, and maple syrup.
Stir well and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Stir again before serving.
Layer with berries and top with coconut flakes.
tips: Stir after 30 minutes to prevent clumping
Any milk works - dairy or plant-based

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, chewy peanut butter cookies packed with protein. Just 4 ingredients!
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix all ingredients until smooth dough forms.
Roll into 12 balls, place on lined baking sheet.
Press with fork to create classic crosshatch pattern.
Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool on pan before moving - they firm up as they cool.
tips: Don't overbake - they should look slightly underdone
Any nut butter works for different flavours

recipes.title: Coconut Bliss Balls
recipes.description: Like a Bounty bar but healthy. Coconut, chocolate, and pure bliss.
instructions: Mix coconut, coconut cream, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Roll into 14 small balls.
Freeze for 30 minutes until firm.
Melt chocolate and dip balls to coat.
Return to freezer until chocolate sets.
tips: Press the mixture firmly so balls hold together
Store in freezer for best texture

recipes.title: Avocado Chocolate Pudding
recipes.description: Silky smooth chocolate pudding made with avocado. You won't believe there's a veggie hiding in there.
instructions: Blend all ingredients until completely smooth.
Scrape down sides and blend again.
Taste and adjust sweetness if needed.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
Top with berries or whipped cream.
tips: Use a very ripe avocado for creamiest texture
Add a shot of espresso for mocha flavour

recipes.title: Baked Pears with Walnuts & Honey
recipes.description: Warm, caramelised pears stuffed with crunchy walnuts and drizzled with honey. Elegant and easy.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Place pear halves cut-side up in baking dish.
Mix walnuts, honey, and cinnamon.
Spoon mixture into pear centers.
Drizzle with melted butter.
Bake 20-25 minutes until pears are tender.
Serve warm with Greek yogurt.
tips: Choose pears that are ripe but still firm
Mascarpone is a decadent alternative to yogurt

recipes.title: Dark Chocolate Dipped Strawberries
recipes.description: Classic romantic dessert. Fresh strawberries dipped in rich dark chocolate.
instructions: Wash strawberries and dry completely.
Melt chocolate with coconut oil.
Dip each strawberry halfway into chocolate.
Place on parchment-lined tray.
Sprinkle with sea salt if using.
Refrigerate until chocolate sets.
tips: Strawberries must be completely dry or chocolate won't stick
Use 70% dark chocolate for best flavour and less sugar

recipes.title: Honey Garlic Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Crispy baked wings with sticky honey garlic glaze. Game day favourite that's actually nutritious.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Pat wings dry and arrange on a wire rack over baking tray.
Bake 40-45 minutes until crispy.
Meanwhile, simmer honey, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and sesame oil.
Toss hot wings in glaze.
Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds.
tips: Wire rack is key for crispy wings all around
Make extra sauce for dipping

recipes.title: Moroccan Spiced Lamb Shoulder
recipes.description: Slow-roasted lamb with warm spices, apricots, and almonds. Fall-apart tender and incredibly aromatic.
instructions: Rub lamb with spices, salt, and pepper.
Sear in a hot pan until browned all over.
Place in roasting tin with garlic, apricots, and stock.
Cover and roast at 160°C (320°F) for 4 hours.
Uncover for last 30 minutes to brown.
Scatter with almonds and fresh coriander.
tips: The meat should fall off the bone when done
Serve with couscous or cauliflower rice

recipes.title: Crispy Skin Snapper with Salsa Verde
recipes.description: Perfectly crispy fish with bright, herby salsa verde. Restaurant-quality in under 20 minutes.
instructions: Blend herbs, capers, anchovies, garlic, and lemon with olive oil for salsa.
Score fish skin, season with salt.
Heat oil in pan over high heat.
Cook fish skin-side down for 4 minutes, pressing gently.
Flip and cook 2 more minutes.
Serve with salsa verde spooned over.
tips: Very hot pan is essential for crispy skin
Don't move the fish while skin is crisping

recipes.title: One-Pot Chicken & Mushroom
recipes.description: Creamy chicken with earthy mushrooms in a one-pot wonder. Comfort food with minimal cleanup.
instructions: Season chicken and brown in oil, about 4 minutes per side. Remove.
Sauté mushrooms until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and thyme, cook 1 minute.
Pour in stock, scrape up browned bits.
Stir in cream and mustard.
Return chicken, simmer 15 minutes until cooked through.
tips: Don't crowd the mushrooms or they'll steam instead of brown
Serve over mashed cauliflower or zucchini noodles

recipes.title: Balsamic Glazed Pork Tenderloin
recipes.description: Juicy pork tenderloin with a sweet-tangy balsamic glaze. Elegant enough for guests, easy enough for weeknights.
instructions: Mix balsamic, honey, mustard, and garlic for glaze.
Season pork with rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Sear in hot oil until browned all over.
Brush with glaze, roast at 200°C (400°F) for 15-18 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes before slicing.
Drizzle with remaining glaze.
tips: Internal temp should reach 63°C (145°F)
Let it rest - the juices redistribute

recipes.title: Chicken Shawarma Bowl
recipes.description: Middle Eastern spiced chicken with all the fixings. Bring the food truck to your kitchen.
instructions: Mix spices and coat chicken thighs.
Grill or pan-fry until cooked through, slice.
Arrange rice in bowls.
Top with chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, and onion.
Add hummus and drizzle with tahini.
tips: Marinate chicken overnight for even more flavour
Pickled turnips are traditional and amazing here

recipes.title: Cobb Salad
recipes.description: The ultimate American composed salad. Rows of chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, and blue cheese.
instructions: Cook bacon until crispy, crumble.
Arrange greens on a large platter.
Create rows of chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and cheese.
Drizzle with vinaigrette just before serving.
tips: Keep ingredients in neat rows for presentation
Toss at the table for interactive dining

recipes.title: Japanese Salmon Onigiri
recipes.description: Japanese rice balls stuffed with flaked salmon. The perfect portable lunch.
instructions: Season rice with vinegar and let cool slightly.
Pan-fry or bake salmon, then flake.
Wet hands with salted water.
Take a handful of rice, make indent, add salmon.
Shape into triangle or ball.
Wrap with nori strip and sprinkle with sesame.
tips: Wet hands prevent sticking
Can be made ahead and wrapped in plastic

recipes.title: Tuscan White Bean Salad
recipes.description: Creamy cannellini beans with tomatoes, basil, and parmesan. Italian simplicity at its finest.
instructions: Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic.
Toss beans with tomatoes, onion, and dressing.
Add basil and parmesan.
Season with salt and pepper.
Let sit 10 minutes for flavours to meld.
tips: Quality olive oil makes a huge difference here
Add tuna or grilled chicken for extra protein

recipes.title: Beef Larb Lettuce Cups
recipes.description: Thai-style minced beef salad in crispy lettuce cups. Spicy, tangy, and totally addictive.
instructions: Toast rice in dry pan until golden, grind to powder.
Cook beef, breaking up, until browned.
Off heat, add fish sauce, lime juice, and chilli.
Toss with shallots, herbs, and rice powder.
Spoon into lettuce cups and serve immediately.
tips: Toasted rice powder adds authentic nutty crunch
Adjust chilli to your heat preference

recipes.title: Protein Acai Bowl
recipes.description: Thick, creamy acai base topped with fruit, granola, and nut butter. Café vibes at home.
instructions: Blend acai, banana, protein powder, and almond milk until thick.
Pour into bowl - should be thick like soft serve.
Top with granola, berries, almond butter, and coconut.
Eat immediately before it melts.
tips: Use minimal liquid for thickest texture
Frozen fruit is essential - fresh won't work

recipes.title: Breakfast Burrito Bowl
recipes.description: All your favourite burrito fillings without the tortilla. Eggs, beans, cheese, and all the toppings.
instructions: Warm black beans in a small pot.
Scramble eggs to your liking.
Arrange beans, eggs, tomatoes, and avocado in bowl.
Top with cheese, salsa, sour cream, and coriander.
tips: Add leftover rice for a heartier bowl
Hot sauce is essential

recipes.title: Salmon & Egg Bagel Stack
recipes.description: Everything bagel topped with cream cheese, smoked salmon, and a perfectly fried egg. Brunch perfection.
instructions: Toast bagel to your liking.
Fry egg sunny-side up or over-easy.
Spread cream cheese on both bagel halves.
Layer salmon, onion, and capers on bottom half.
Top with fried egg and dill.
Add top half or serve open-faced.
tips: A runny yolk is essential
Everything bagel seasoning on top adds extra flavour

recipes.title: Sweet Potato & Egg Hash
recipes.description: Crispy sweet potato cubes with runny eggs on top. Hearty, colourful, and satisfying.
instructions: Cook sweet potato in oil over medium heat for 15 minutes.
Add capsicum and onion, cook 5 more minutes.
Season with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Make 4 wells and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook until eggs are set.
Garnish with parsley.
tips: Don't stir the potatoes too much - let them get crispy
Add crumbled feta or goat cheese on top

recipes.title: Protein French Toast
recipes.description: Classic French toast made protein-packed. Golden, custard-soaked bread with fresh berries.
instructions: Whisk eggs, protein powder, milk, and cinnamon until smooth.
Dip bread slices in mixture, coating both sides.
Cook in buttered pan over medium heat, 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve with berries and Greek yogurt.
tips: Day-old bread works best - it absorbs better
Don't soak too long or it gets soggy

recipes.title: Red Velvet Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Stunning red pancakes with cream cheese drizzle. Special occasion breakfast that's still healthy.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water and beetroot powder.
Cook pancakes over medium heat until bubbles form.
Flip and cook other side.
Blend cream cheese, yogurt, and vanilla for drizzle.
Stack pancakes and drizzle cream cheese mixture over top.
tips: Beetroot powder gives colour without affecting taste much
Can use red food colouring if you prefer

recipes.title: Lemon Ricotta Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Light, fluffy pancakes made extra pillowy with ricotta. Italian-inspired breakfast perfection.
instructions: Fold ricotta, water, lemon zest, and juice into pancake mix.
Don't overmix - lumps are fine.
Cook over medium-low heat until bubbles form.
Flip gently and cook until golden.
Serve with fresh blueberries.
tips: Ricotta makes these extra tender - don't skip it
Lower heat than normal to cook through without burning

recipes.title: Birthday Cake Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Funfetti-style pancakes for celebrations. Sprinkles inside AND on top. Because why not?
instructions: Mix pancake mix with water and vanilla.
Fold in 1 tbsp sprinkles gently.
Cook pancakes over medium heat.
Mix yogurt with honey for frosting.
Top pancakes with yogurt mixture and remaining sprinkles.
tips: Add sprinkles just before cooking or colours will bleed
Perfect for kids' birthdays

recipes.title: Caprese Skewers
recipes.description: Cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and basil on a stick. Party appetiser that's actually healthy.
instructions: Thread tomato, basil leaf, and bocconcini onto small skewers.
Arrange on serving platter.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper.
tips: Use the best quality tomatoes you can find
Can be assembled a few hours ahead

recipes.title: Prosciutto-Wrapped Melon
recipes.description: Sweet cantaloupe wrapped in salty prosciutto. The classic Italian combo that never fails.
instructions: Cut cantaloupe into 8 wedges.
Wrap each wedge with a slice of prosciutto.
Arrange on platter.
Garnish with mint and black pepper.
tips: Make sure melon is ripe and sweet
Honeydew works well too

recipes.title: Tzatziki with Veggie Sticks
recipes.description: Cool, creamy cucumber yogurt dip with crunchy vegetables. Refreshing and protein-packed.
instructions: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess water in a tea towel.
Mix yogurt, cucumber, garlic, dill, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate 30 minutes for flavours to meld.
Serve with fresh veggie sticks.
tips: Squeezing the cucumber is essential or tzatziki will be watery
Gets better after a day in the fridge

recipes.title: Almond Butter Stuffed Dates
recipes.description: Medjool dates stuffed with almond butter. Nature's candy with a protein boost.
instructions: Slice dates open lengthwise.
Fill each with 1/2 tbsp almond butter.
Drizzle with melted chocolate if using.
Sprinkle with sea salt.
Refrigerate until chocolate sets.
tips: Can use any nut butter
Add a whole almond on top for crunch

recipes.title: Cheese & Pickle Plate
recipes.description: Assorted cheese with pickles, olives, and nuts. Simple ploughman's-style snacking.
instructions: Arrange cheeses on a board or plate.
Add pickles, olives, walnuts, and apple slices.
Serve at room temperature for best flavour.
tips: Take cheese out of fridge 30 minutes before serving
Add grainy mustard for dipping

recipes.title: Protein Mug Cake
recipes.description: Single-serve chocolate cake ready in 2 minutes. Warm, gooey, and packed with protein.
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients in a microwave-safe mug.
Add egg and almond milk, stir until smooth.
Microwave for 60-90 seconds until set but still moist.
Let cool 1 minute before eating.
tips: Don't overcook - should be slightly gooey in center
Top with a spoonful of Greek yogurt

recipes.title: Grilled Peaches with Mascarpone
recipes.description: Caramelised peaches with creamy mascarpone and honey. Summer dessert perfection.
instructions: Heat grill or grill pan to high.
Brush peach halves with a little oil.
Grill cut-side down for 3-4 minutes until charred.
Mix mascarpone with vanilla.
Place peaches on plate, top with mascarpone.
Drizzle with honey and scatter pistachios.
tips: Peaches should be ripe but still firm
Works great on the BBQ

recipes.title: Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Silky Italian cream dessert with real vanilla bean. Elegant and easier than you think.
instructions: Bloom gelatin in 2 tbsp cold water.
Heat cream, milk, vanilla bean, and honey until steaming.
Remove from heat, stir in gelatin until dissolved.
Remove vanilla bean, scrape seeds back in.
Pour into 4 ramekins, refrigerate 4 hours until set.
Serve with fresh berries.
tips: Don't boil the cream mixture
Can unmould by dipping ramekins in hot water briefly

recipes.title: Chocolate Avocado Truffles
recipes.description: Rich chocolate truffles with a secret healthy ingredient. No one will guess there's avocado inside.
instructions: Blend avocado until completely smooth.
Mix with melted chocolate, cocoa, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Refrigerate 1 hour until firm.
Roll into 12 balls.
Roll in cocoa powder to coat.
Store in fridge.
tips: Use a very ripe avocado for smoothest texture
Roll in coconut or nuts for variety

recipes.title: Lemon Curd Tarts
recipes.description: Tangy lemon curd in almond flour tart shells. Bright, zesty, and naturally gluten-free.
instructions: Mix almond flour, melted butter, and honey for crust.
Press into 6 mini tart pans, bake at 180°C for 10 minutes.
Whisk eggs, lemon juice, zest, and honey over low heat.
Stir constantly until thickened, remove from heat.
Stir in butter until smooth.
Fill cooled tart shells with curd, chill until set.
tips: Don't let curd boil or eggs will scramble
Top with fresh berries or whipped cream

recipes.title: Espresso Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Coffee-infused pancakes for the caffeine lovers. Wake up and eat your coffee.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with espresso and water.
Cook pancakes over medium heat until bubbles form.
Flip and cook until golden.
Serve with Greek yogurt and chocolate chips.
tips: Instant espresso powder works if you don't have a machine
Add a pinch of cinnamon for mocha vibes

recipes.title: Oat & Honey Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Hearty oat pancakes sweetened with honey. Simple, wholesome, and incredibly satisfying.
instructions: Mix pancake mix with oats, water, and honey.
Let sit 2 minutes for oats to soften.
Cook pancakes over medium heat.
Top with sliced banana and extra honey drizzle.
tips: Quick oats blend in smoother if you prefer less texture
These are extra filling - great for active days

recipes.title: Lemon Dill Baked Cod
recipes.description: Flaky white fish with fresh lemon and dill. Light, elegant, and on the table in 20 minutes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place cod in baking dish, season with salt and pepper.
Top with garlic, dill, and lemon slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and wine if using.
Bake 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily.
tips: Don't overcook - cod dries out quickly
Any firm white fish works here

recipes.title: Chimichurri Steak
recipes.description: Perfectly grilled steak with bright, herby chimichurri sauce. Argentine steakhouse vibes at home.
instructions: Blend parsley, oregano, garlic, vinegar, oil, and chilli for chimichurri.
Let steak come to room temperature.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
Grill or pan-sear 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest 5 minutes, slice against the grain.
Spoon chimichurri over steak.
tips: Make chimichurri ahead - it gets better with time
Let steak rest as long as you cooked it

recipes.title: Japanese Chicken Katsu
recipes.description: Crispy panko-crusted chicken cutlets with tangy katsu sauce. Japanese comfort food classic.
instructions: Pound chicken to even 1cm thickness.
Set up breading station: flour, egg, panko.
Coat chicken in flour, then egg, then panko.
Shallow fry in oil 4-5 minutes per side until golden.
Drain on paper towels, slice into strips.
Serve over cabbage with tonkatsu sauce.
tips: Press panko firmly onto chicken for better adhesion
Oil should be about 170°C (340°F)

recipes.title: Lemon Butter Fish with Capers
recipes.description: Pan-fried fish in a classic piccata-style sauce. Tangy, buttery, and absolutely delicious.
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper.
Pan-fry in oil and 1 tbsp butter until cooked through.
Remove fish, add wine and lemon juice to pan.
Let reduce, then add remaining butter and capers.
Swirl until sauce emulsifies.
Pour over fish and garnish with parsley.
tips: Have all ingredients ready - the sauce comes together quickly
Don't boil the sauce after adding butter

recipes.title: Greek Chicken Souvlaki
recipes.description: Marinated chicken skewers with tzatziki and fresh salad. Greek street food at its finest.
instructions: Marinate chicken in oil, lemon, garlic, and oregano for 30 minutes.
Thread onto skewers.
Make tzatziki by mixing yogurt with grated cucumber and garlic.
Grill skewers 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve with tzatziki, salad, and pita.
tips: Soak wooden skewers in water to prevent burning
Marinate overnight for best flavour

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon Sushi Bowl
recipes.description: Deconstructed sushi in bowl form. All the flavours without the rolling skills required.
instructions: Place sushi rice in bowl.
Arrange salmon, avocado, cucumber, and edamame on top.
Scatter nori strips and sesame seeds.
Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.
tips: Season rice with rice vinegar for authentic flavour
Sriracha mayo makes a great addition

recipes.title: Mediterranean Chicken Wrap
recipes.description: Grilled chicken with hummus, feta, and veggies in a wrap. Portable Mediterranean goodness.
instructions: Season and grill chicken until cooked through, slice.
Spread hummus on each wrap.
Layer greens, chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and feta.
Roll tightly, tucking in sides.
Cut in half diagonally to serve.
tips: Warm the wrap slightly for easier rolling
Don't overfill or it won't roll properly

recipes.title: Thai Peanut Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Crunchy Asian salad with creamy peanut dressing. Packed with colour and flavour.
instructions: Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, and a splash of water.
Toss cabbage, carrot, capsicum, and edamame together.
Top with sliced chicken.
Drizzle with peanut dressing.
Garnish with crushed peanuts.
tips: Add water to dressing until it reaches desired consistency
Rotisserie chicken makes this super quick

recipes.title: Protein-Packed Power Bowl
recipes.description: Quinoa, chickpeas, egg, and veggies in one nourishing bowl. Fuel for whatever your day throws at you.
instructions: Arrange quinoa in a bowl.
Add spinach, chickpeas, tomatoes, and avocado.
Top with egg.
Drizzle with tahini thinned with lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
tips: Batch cook quinoa on weekends for quick assembly
Add any protein you have on hand

recipes.title: Prawn & Mango Salad
recipes.description: Sweet mango, juicy prawns, and a zingy lime dressing. Tropical freshness in every bite.
instructions: Toss greens with olive oil and half the lime juice.
Arrange prawns and mango on top.
Scatter red onion, coriander, and chilli.
Drizzle remaining lime juice over.
Season with salt and pepper.
tips: Use perfectly ripe mango for best sweetness
Avocado is a great addition

recipes.title: Mini Frittata Cups
recipes.description: Baked egg cups with veggies and cheese. Perfect for meal prep snacking.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin.
Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Divide spinach and sun-dried tomatoes among cups.
Pour egg mixture over, top with feta.
Bake 18-20 minutes until set.
Garnish with basil.
tips: Store in fridge for up to 5 days
Reheat in microwave for 20-30 seconds

recipes.title: Ants on a Log
recipes.description: Childhood classic upgraded. Celery, peanut butter, and raisins - simple but surprisingly satisfying.
instructions: Cut celery stalks to desired length.
Fill the groove with peanut butter.
Press raisins into the peanut butter.
tips: Use almond butter for variety
Dark chocolate chips instead of raisins for a treat

recipes.title: Homemade Beef Jerky
recipes.description: Make your own beef jerky without the additives. High protein, zero junk.
instructions: Freeze beef for 1 hour for easier slicing.
Slice against the grain as thin as possible.
Mix all marinade ingredients.
Marinate beef for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Arrange on oven racks over baking trays.
Bake at 80°C (175°F) for 4 hours, flipping halfway.
tips: Thinner slices = crispier jerky
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks
